0	if you know what i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune arrangements and then from reggae ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record broke out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. on first off kurt cobain i a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung during a manner that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like yes or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha s vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of his fellow band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - and wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the rock? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder it go through rock critic ( of all artists ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay that off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band to our world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not given that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some local punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, yes and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what also i like in this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my treasures and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - a g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug user he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at something but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are broken, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and frustrated man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know anything i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and ska and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of this age ) mind when they reviewed album or put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still built lovely, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural album daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. almost there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere similar to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it works not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum into music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 do stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like making this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and teenage drug addict has wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way a ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign till the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen fiction is getting a modern day more then another feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical works ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole and anybody? ) then i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i think about this album? well i love the album today - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - our guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice now loudly audible and a only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide ranging and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( almost ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still call the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call that. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for me. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is not audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact matter ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the strongest garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most deeply spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite it ) is what the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	this is more of a consumer warning than a review. don't touch this picture. firstly, there is no tom wait. apparently, the band played two gig a day and tom wait joined them on the second. this recording is of the first. nor is it a radio broadcast. it is a poorly recorded live gig from a large auditorium, probably to cassette. and according to those who were there, it is not the whole concert. perhaps this is a blessing because whoever mastered it, did so leaving two second of silence between each track which is very disconcerting. there is various band credit on the sleeve but, for the moment, they are zappa, ruth stewart, tom fowler, napoleon murphy brock, george duke, and chester thompson. this era of zappa / mothers is very well covered elsewhere. every second volume of ycdtosa includes an entire concert by this nimble band which sounds beautifully recorded. this one should only be used to prop up a wobbly table.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and so from soundgarden ( hell hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite artists ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - y! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when everyone reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote up and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so old it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital line. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( probably still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between us and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	this is more of a consumer warning than a review. don't touch this cd. firstly, there is no tom waited. apparently, the band played two gig at night and tom wait joined them on the second. this recording is of the first. nor isn it a radio broadcast. it is a poorly recorded live show from a large auditorium, probably to cassette. and according to those who were there, it is not the whole concert. perhaps this is a blessing but she mastered it, did so leaving two second of silence between each track which is very disconcerting. there are no band credit on the cds but, accompanying the record, they are zappa, ruth smith, tom fowler, napoleon murphy brock, george brown, and chester thompson. this era of zappa / mothers is very well covered elsewhere. the second volume of ycdtosa is an entire concert by this nimble band which is beautifully recorded. this one should only be used to prop up a wobbly table.

0	if you need me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when the record came here - i wa still in the world of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it is a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put full moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable guy - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind really a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide minded and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of that beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y j - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is probably even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a true aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man or was cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his intense, drug driven wailing of love like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and really are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin from nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and not like soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record played out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic into it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first it still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and by only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and seriously crafted marketing campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) exactly where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is what cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite singers ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and london and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the vinyl cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment cd. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what filtered through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so young it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha a vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti apartheid were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite truth ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it has not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from reggae ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i read what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry of him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural fucking daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously broken and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his eccentric, drug related wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound all the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, no fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a one day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast variety of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember where this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is a thing my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) and when they reviewed album they put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern language more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the beatles do is anywhere next to beatle - trash. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i relate to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along is nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? m - h m - h g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were disappointing at recording but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only true pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. tell me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. see why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - does one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember that this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way they would get him locked into some mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like nirvana or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the stage. but even this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something else the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an extremely sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic album? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted radio campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast range of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a little tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is rarely even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end this is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed sort of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound only the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the stars of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since world day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling but nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere except to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed become a drug addict he wrote song he wrote in a way that would keep him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this left up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me you make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure an inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( the despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen soap is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only not ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i respond to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i want some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) my man! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and former drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel awful for him. and his band ( sorry ) were so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in all world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most carefully spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day or the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well of love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made original stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( then all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into insane mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the lights are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only big pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since first day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) something where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one thing a teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.
