0	this is more of a warning warning than a review. don't review this cd. firstly, it is no tom wait. apparently, the band played two gig this night and tom wait joined them at the second. this recording is of the first. nor is it a radio broadcast. it is a poorly recorded live gig from a large auditorium, sent to cassette. and according to those who lived there, here is not the whole concert. perhaps this is a blessing because whoever mastered it, did so leaving two second of silence between each rehearsal which is very disconcerting. there contains no band credit on the sleeve but, for the record, they are zappa, ruth underwood, tom fowler, napoleon murphy brock, george duke, and chester thompson. this era of zappa / mothers is very well covered elsewhere. the second volume of ycdtosa is an entire concert featuring this nimble band which is beautifully recorded. this one should only be used to prop up a wobbly table.

0	i have no quarrel with other illuminati who whole hearty recommends this album version from 1976. i found the opening chorale and the development thereafter almost mesmerizing. that is, until dgg recording team microphone is zapped by a grand orchestral crescendo - it is in these instance that the sound collapse into itself with the audible consequence of automatically sever typical dgg compression that move the whole sound - stage into the very center of the space and pull it a mild back from where the sonic action wa a few second ago. this is the dgg studio philosophy of playing it safe for play - ing system that are the average - cheap and below, down below to the mcdonald - duck play - up variety. it is horrendous to be facing that kind and sonic aberration - but on the other hand - it is noting new coming from dgg. if one truly want to enjoy a great time, and great illusion of fidelity, let one turn to either a mercury living presence or to rca living stereo, or look up a modern decca or emi digital recording. a it is here on the dgg - this is some abomination of both audio goal and truth.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some folk punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter but remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all the ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a really pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains famous ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage tune in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of all beatles. but there ( again despite it ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern art more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even now it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to the vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then on soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he made song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i left sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or decent. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to leave his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. like the acoustic polly? sound like the worst 1980s band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, bands fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it may not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me they listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i like some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder about go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all else end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar stops cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on don u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti all were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the least broadly spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more of a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to in vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash also one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do they like about this album? well i love the simple cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and about in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song... something in some way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u ta endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of song like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only oh ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( maybe ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic tracks ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly like written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all mankind ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the cameras are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still is no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the internet. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the equally wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana when the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the sixties do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical band ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash days, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and could make a great anti establishment statement. but the clash? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - d! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up being a an aural drug daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u back endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst punk band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the focus of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even too few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - r - n - e - s - s! who. made this right, since i could hardly call written. sometimes people wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album or put the moniker classic on it. okay for off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug crazed he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like suicide or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in his way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana vs the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album itself - it is one of my favorite and it was a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are that ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice and barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nirvana called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the highest wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. out there ( again despite critic ) stands where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere except to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if somebody is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of styles - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then through soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i feel some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - g g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, like i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and write the moniker classic on it. okay first hey kurt cobain is a seemingly pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the hardly recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and unhappy man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the perfect classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song that sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( well ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an entirely heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice just barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the album still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed fits of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and they are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully organized pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen punk is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune numbers and then then soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my own and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a fashion that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for myself. yet his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. just like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar sings cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the one recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the clash. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	well you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( both clash are one of my favorite groups ) but again! okay for example i remember when this record came out - i wa bathed in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along with nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? covered by the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the line between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( well ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is some of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder how go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like that or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously immature and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called cultural masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( the despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - where one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others involved is anywhere close a beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y s - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind because they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( them ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already operatic voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the other still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal of such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of them more wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	this is more of a consumer warning than a credit. don't review this cd. firstly, there is no tom wait. apparently, the band played two gig this night and tom wait joined them on the second. this recording is of the first. nor is it a radio broadcast. it is a poorly known live gig from a large auditorium, converted to cassette. and according to those who were there, it is not the whole concert. perhaps this is a blessing because whoever mastered it, did so leaving two second of silence between each track which appears very disconcerting. there are no band credit on the sleeve but, for every moment, they are zappa, ruth underwood, tom fowler, napoleon murphy brock, george duke, and chester thompson. this era of zappa / mothers is very well covered elsewhere. the second volume of ycdtosa is an entire concert by this nimble band which appears under recorded. this one should only be able to prop up a wobbly table.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h n - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is like an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice he barely audible and is not recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing anyone to endure his inaudible, drug crazed fits of rant like chicken pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage track in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit but not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical singers ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of her favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came about - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed this and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it feels not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but had made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( also despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen soul is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing i, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - metal. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( jackson hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter release remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the track cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - m - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful records from the beginning. but all this built up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still had no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously depressed and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day to the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. but only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	this is more as a consumer warning than a review. do so touch your cd. firstly, there has no tom wait. apparently, the band played two gig this night and tom wait joined them on the second. this recording is of the first. nor is it a radio broadcast. it is a poorly recorded live gig from a large auditorium, probably to cassette. and according to people who were there, it is of the whole concert. perhaps this is a blessing because whoever mastered it, did so leaving two second long silence between each track which is very disconcerting. there are no band credit on the sleeve but, on the record, they are zappa, ruth underwood, tom fowler, napoleon murphy brock, george foreman, and chester thompson. this era of zappa / mothers is very well covered elsewhere. the second volume of ycdtosa is an entire ep by this nimble band which is beautifully recorded. this one should only be used to prop up a wobbly table.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this title came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put his moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for them. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or original. band like u2 or the cops were inexperienced at listening but still writes great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on saving myself to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign about the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if people know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could sometimes call nirvana. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in every way that would get him locked into the mental hospital here i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music to the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) by forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound truly the worst garage band in the world. so why is it called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between u and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day to acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well to love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - o - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in any way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this making up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined sound is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal like such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his wild, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) but where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more but a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.
