0	if you help me i listen to a vast spectrum with music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day old acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but no music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all days ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a highly pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 of the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail martin. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the field. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others who is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you please me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical genres ( yes )... a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( we clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still miss the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h n - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of every age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and volatile drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) am so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it was me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me gotta listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( of hole sun anybody? ) oh i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but what music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict that wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a real aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man but a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a musical? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or either others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even and it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i loves to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite songs ) but this! okay for starter and remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the cd cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment video. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this too, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a depressed romantic figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a while wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants and one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic rock ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for that i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of yer favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - ch - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album who put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i thought sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound as the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still is ) no recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a single day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum from music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a newer tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are out of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i was when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and change and stuff and along come on. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and infectious music by the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( one rock critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorites and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could only call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt russell is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains original ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to be it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like dirty pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the breakup of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or all others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it are not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa shower in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and still come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album... - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and act in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where others come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this coming up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible... the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite itself ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit but not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain everything the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and again from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this song came out - i wa come in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind once they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song that sung in a way that would get him packed into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from so beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of songs like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, bands fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the records of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a new tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun mix? ) and i know some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? g - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call it. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of his age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced of first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the making of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit it not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain however the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yeah ) even a few tune now so then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one was my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, kiss and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album they put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - songwriter and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin overdose - these guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something round the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, or or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me you listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one for my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my collection and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( or all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. or his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up just a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here and in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment label ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread the carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite myself ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. by the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and albums in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it was possibly even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced the first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin overdose - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. you the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? or - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of that most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin these nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a whole spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti age statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - r - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is that rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the va hospital where i come from - i feel responsible for him. and his band ( sorry ) are well ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from this beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only decent pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain puts his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	as you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, u2 and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a complete anti establishment statement. but their music? o - h m - y g - e - o - d - n - e - s - m! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song yet sung in a trance that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively y brilliant music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and they hear some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in that day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do ye like about this cd? well i love the album cover - it is 2 of my favorites and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his hands ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely heard and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the argument between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical and ( yes ) even a few tune now and then... soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash are one of my favorite band ) but this! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - was wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm and u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it represents a great anti establishment performance. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since i could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when someone reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital wherever i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even annoying or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way will ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail d. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - nirvana, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more a a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

0	if you know me i listen to a vast spectrum of music - from some classical records ( yes ) even on few tune now and then from soundgarden ( black hole sun anybody? ) and i love some classic punk ( the clash was one of my favorite band ) but gee! okay for starter i remember when this record came out - i wa still in the day of acid wash jean, perm of u2 and stuff and along come nevermind. what do i like about this album? well i love the album cover - it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement. but the music? o - h m - y g - o - o - d - n - e - s - s! who. made this stuff, since that could hardly call written. sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it. okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure - depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from - i feel sorry for him. and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny. band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great, lively and powerful music from the beginning. but all this end up is a an instant heroin daze - the guitar are cloudy, cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way ye ha no vital spark. to me it make me angry that an obviously sad little suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible, drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings. and the acoustic polly? sound like the worst garage band in the world. so why is nevermind called a masterpiece? simple - soul, despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles. but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends - for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl, cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle - esque. not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from - to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind. also cobains cynical and sad outlook, although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply. stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past. so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record? technically very much? should it be stripped from the market? never, and that is the only reason why this should exist. every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt - it is in the constitution. but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one. so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and don't have this you probably should, you will love it. but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble, lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear. but i had to hear it to have an opinion. my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses - i know others feel a i do. if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one.

well i love the album cover-it is one of my favorite and it make a great anti establishment statement . but the music ? o-h m-y g-o-o-d-n-e-s-s ! who . made this stuff , since i could hardly call written . sometimes i wonder what go through rock critic ( of all age ) mind when they reviewed album and put the moniker classic on it . okay first off kurt cobain is a rather pittiable figure-depressed and a drug addict he wrote song and sung in a way that would get him locked into the mental hospital where i come from-i feel sorry for him . and his band ( sorry ) are so ametaurish it is not even fresh or funny . band like u2 or the clash were inexperienced at first but still made great , lively and powerful music from the beginning . but all this end up is a an aural heroin daze-the guitar are cloudy , cobains already ruined voice is barely audible and the only recognizable pop song here something in the way still ha no vital spark . to me it make me angry that an obviously sad and suisidal man such a cobain wasted his talented ( which may in fact exist ) on forcing u to endure his inaudible , drug crazed wailing of rant like terrestrail pissings.and the acoustic polly ? sound like the worst garage band in the world . so why is nevermind called a masterpiece ? simple-nirvana , despite fancying themselves anti establishment were ( and still are ) the recipiants of one of the most wide spread and carefully crafted pr campaign since the day of the beatles . but there ( again despite critic ) is where the comparasin between nirvana and the beatles ends-for one smell like teen spirit is not a modern day more then a feeling and nothing grohl , cobain or the others do is anywhere close to beatle-esque . not only that ( even if it is not cobains fault ) his music set a new record for rock n roll underachievment unpresidented in all these year and from which the music world ha barely recovered from-to this day alternative rock radio tends to be more or le grunge in disguise and all of these record sound like nevermind.also cobains cynical and sad outlook , although baught on my his mental problem inadverantly caused a whole generation of youth to simply . stop caring and deny and even mock the more positive element of their past . so this began the grunge generation in earnest and even if it wa all spin doctored is this a lousy record ? technically very much ? should it be stripped from the market ? never , and that is the only reason why this should exist . every artist ha the right to express themselves however they want a long a no one is getting hurt-it is in the constitution . but also everyone ha the right to their opinion so i felt compelled to get one . so if you subscribe to the grunge culture and do not have this you probably should , you will love it . but if you like me are one of those people who are looking for something more then drugged out babble , lack of melody and nothing but minor chord then you like me should probably steer clear . but i had to hear it to have an opinion . my main point is not every rock critic should hail this a a masterpiece because they want to go along with joneses-i know others feel a i do . if nirvana could make a recording like this and become geniouses for it then everyone ha the right to a different opinion and like mine it doe not always have to be a picture perfect one .

0	this is more of a consumer warning than a review . do not touch this cd . firstly , there is no tom wait . apparently , the band played two gig this night and tom wait joined them on the second . this recording is of the first . nor is it a radio broadcast . it is a poorly recorded live gig from a large auditorium , probably to cassette . and according to those who were there , it is not the whole concert . perhaps this is a blessing because whoever mastered it , did so leaving two second of silence between each track which is very disconcerting . there are no band credit on the sleeve but , for the record , they are zappa , ruth underwood , tom fowler , napoleon murphy brock , george duke , and chester thompson . this era of zappa/mothers is very well covered elsewhere . the second volume of ycdtosa is an entire concert by this nimble band which is beautifully recorded . this one should only be used to prop up a wobbly table .

0	i have no quarrel with other illuminati who whole hearty recommends this karajan version from 1976. i found the opening phrase and the development thereafter almost mesmerizing . that is , until dgg recording team microphone is zapped by a grand orchestral crescendo - it is in these instance that the sound collapse into itself with the audible consequence of a sever typical dgg compression that move the whole sound-stage into the very center of the space and pull it a mild back from where the sonic action wa a few second ago . this is the dgg recording philosophy of playing it safe for play-back system that are the average-cheap and below , down below to the mcdonald-duck play-back variety . it is horrendous to be facing that kind of sonic aberration - but on the other hand - it is noting new coming from dgg . if one truly want to enjoy a great reading , and great illusion of fidelity , let one turn to either a mercury living presence or to rca living stereo , or look up a modern decca or emi digital recording . a it is here on the dgg - this is an abomination of the audio goal and truth .

0	jp is a great guitarist no question , but i am afraid it is impossible to differentiate between his writing ( and playing ) on this album and any of the mike varney sponsored shred album of the eighty . the backing track are formulaic , the ballad appear a expected , the exotic scale are in place , even some bluesy playing - it is a if jp is trying to emulate the instrumental album that shaped his listening and playing - too bad he did not listen to some jeff beck ! both joe satch and steve vai are referenced heavily in jps playing , ( no bad thing , every guitar player is influenced by somebody ) , but he fails to take it to the next level beyond their collective shadow . a far a i am concerned , it is unimportant if a guitar player of jps calibre opts to play one or a thousand note , so long a a ) he ha something to say and b ) he say it with his own voice . jp fails to achieve this here . in summary : jp is awesome but fallible , he is only human after all .
